thread.title: Letter to the editor: Zinke deserves your vote for his support of military | Letters To Editor | bozemandailychronicle.com
thread.title_full: Letter to the editor: Zinke deserves your vote for his support of military | Letters To Editor | bozemandailychronicle.com

author: John Lind
title: Letter to the editor: Zinke deserves your vote for his support of military | Letters To Editor | bozemandailychronicle.com
text:
I am writing to publicly thank Congressman Ryan Zinke for his support of America’s military.
Congressman Zinke is a retired Navy SEAL who was a part of SEAL Team One and SEAL Team Six. He earned numerous medals while serving, including two Bronze Stars, and served on Operation IRAQI FREEDOM. After 23 years of service, he retired as a Commander.
Zinke’s dedication to America is evident through his military service and he continues to be dedicated now as a Representative for Montana in Washington, D.C.
In June 2024, he voted to fully fund veterans’ healthcare programs. In July 2023, he voted for the National Defense Authorization Act to fund for the United States military and raise pay for our troops. Also in July 2023, he voted to fund veterans’ benefits and veterans’ programs.
Shockingly, these bills were not passed with unanimous, bipartisan support. Somehow, it has become a bold claim for members of Congress to unabashedly stand with our troops.
A veteran with a strong backbone is rare these days, and for the sake of future generations, we need more veterans — especially statesmen like Ryan Zinke — elected to our government. If you agree, join me in electing more veterans to Congress.
John Lind
Belgrade
